alert.note: Alert for Central Coast Range of Western Oregon; Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 1:39AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...BRIEF BURST OF GUSTY SOUTH WINDS EARLY THIS MORNING... Low pressure rapidly developed overnight just off the coast near the Oregon/California border. This system is stronger and is tracking closer to the coast than previously expected. Therefore a brief period of gusty south winds is likely along the central coast of Oregon and adjacent Coast Range areas. South wind gusts will approach 40 mph for the coastal communities, with gusts up to 50 mph possible for the beaches, headlands, and nearby coastal ridges. Winds will increase sharply near Florence around 230 AM this morning, spreading northward along the coast in the following hours. The period of strongest winds will only last a couple hours and winds will settle down by midday today. Isolated power outages will be possible due to the gusty winds this morning.

area.areaDesc: Central Coast Range of Western Oregon; Central Oregon Coast
